item.title: Get You a Free SSL Cert
item.author: river@ryc.one (River Yang)
item.description:
I like free stuff… well, who doesn’t?

I’m currently hosting this website with cloudflare CDN, so the certificate is free by default (Thanks so much Cloudflare!)

Well, but I still prefer something in control, or maybe encrypt some data or using v2ray 😆

item.title: AWS SSO With ADFS - Part 1
item.author: river@ryc.one (River Yang)
item.description:
I’m a lazy man, so always thinking to integrate things together to reduce anything to remember.

AWS provides its own way to authenticate users via IAM module, however it’s just another system to me, so as another credential to me to manage…

I guess any IT won’t like it as too many places to create/delete/disable users, so does user… I think pretty much security will join the party too.

item.title: PowerShell Run as Another User & Elevate the Process

I’m very noob .Net C# developer, but I remember this:

1
2

<compare> ? <value of true> : <value of false>

item.title: PowerShell - Multidimensional Arrays in PowerShell
item.author: river@ryc.one (River Yang)
item.description:
You may have some arrays like this:

1
2
3
4
5
6
7
8

$year1 = @()
$year1 += "Cindy"
$year1 += "Candy"
$year1 += "Mandy"
$year2 = @()
$year2 += "Chris"
$year2 += "Green"
$year2 += "Richard"

item.title: PowerShell Simple Retry Logic
item.author: river@ryc.one (River Yang)
item.description:
Well, this is quite a dirty fix for anything not stable…

First time failed? Run second time, failed? Third time again… Only exits successful or retried more than 3 times.

item.title: TFS Build Server Stops Working - Permission Issue
item.author: river@ryc.one (River Yang)
item.description:
We got an issue for TFS build server today, it doesn’t build anything.

Symptoms

  • From Visual Studio, we cannot see any progress for the build.
  • From the build server, we cannot see any build being triggered, all agents status are “Ready”.
